scenarioDescription:
The bet UMi Exoplanetary System


Overview

bet UMi is a star with 1.4 times the mass of the Sun, and 38.3 times its radius. It is located 126.47 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2.95 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

bet UMi is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the bet UMi system


bet UMi b

bet UMi b was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory observatory, in 2014-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.40 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of bet UMi b is 1939.800 times the mass of Earth. The radius of bet UMi b is 12.700 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, bet UMi b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system bet UMi, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory.
name: bet UMi - System With 1 Exoplanet
